author: James G. Stavridis
title: America’s Security Depends on Mexico
text:
Joaquin Guzman Loera, the notorious drug kingpin known as “El Chapo,” landed in handcuffs last year in New York, where he now awaits trial. Twice El Chapo had escaped from detention in Mexico, so after the authorities there recaptured him, they agreed to send him to the U.S. to face prosecution.

This shows how far the U.S.-Mexico security partnership has developed since 1994, when the North American Free Trade Agreement took effect. As President Trump fights illegal immigration and the drug trade, he should keep Mexico’s...
